meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'lank': thin and ungraceful in form or build.
meanings.sent1: She was the lankest girl in the class, with arms like twigs.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow in the field looked lankest after the harsh winter winds.
meanings.sent3: The lankest tree in the forest kept bending over, trying to touch its toes.
meanings.sent4: His lankest excuses were like feeble whispers in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The lankest pole in the tent struggled to hold up the heavy fabric.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'lank': lacking stiffness or rigidity.
meanings.sent1: The lankest spaghetti noodles flopped over the edge of the plate.
meanings.sent2: The lankest rubber band snapped easily when stretched.
meanings.sent3: The lankest balloon refused to float, sulking in the corner.
meanings.sent4: Her lankest efforts to stand tall were met with constant setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The lankest straw in the bunch bent under the weight of the thirsty crow.
